author: quintin
title: Cardano Music Marketplace
description: There is huge demand for a NFT Marketplace catering to music and audio while onboarding independent musicians from Web 2.0.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem raised in this proposal is the lack of an NFT Marketplace space that serves the music industry, one of the largest and most money moving in the world. We already have several solutions on web2 regarding the subject, but there are few solutions from web3 that work with this universe. Therefore, the proponents intend to create a platform specifically geared towards music, so that they can mint music NFTs, play their tracks through a cross-chain media player (it would be interesting if the proponents explained this concept better); finally, that they could share their content and create NFTs from it, generating profit for both themselves and greater movement on the Cardano blockchain. The proponents claim that the platform will be simple and that they already have a Marketplace in which some independent artists from selected countries can release content, from what I understand. In my view, it would be interesting if more details had been attached about the platform itself. It is not said what functionality they would have besides music playback, minting and selling NFTs; could there be other possibilities there, some innovations? I would also like to know more precisely how the construction of the design of this platform would be, I entered the website that they attached, but there is no way to see any content without a registration, so I could not have a preview of what the interface. However, even though not so much detail was given in relation to the interface itself, the proposal is well aligned with the challenge of Dapps, productions and integrations, as it offers a solution that (as far as I know) is quite new at Cardano, we don't have many funded projects that relate to the musical universe. So, it is quite possible that a new wave of people will be attracted to our blockchain from this project: both musicians and consumers. I believe that the proposal will meet the requirements of the challenge well, increasing the number of active users in the community, creating a value application that will benefit Cardano as it will popularize our blockchain; the more NFTs will be minted on the network, the more digital wallets will be created (both the artists, to receive the revenue for the active tokens, and customers who want to buy the NFTs, for example). A suggestion that I would like to make, in addition to a better detail about the platform, would be the following: maybe it would be positive to include a short explanatory video on the platform that would detail the main concepts for artists who do not know about blockchain, so that they can coin NFTs , finally, they can carry out actions with Cardano's technologies and insert themselves in the cryptographic context, even if they do not have a previous familiarity with this universe. The proposal is quite valid, it just needs some improvements to make it perfect.
f6_assessments.q1: Speaking of script issues, the information is given in a very superficial way. It is not possible to understand with much specificity what would happen during the process of carrying out the project. First, it would be interesting for the proponents to have divided the whole into phases, for these phases to be made up of months, and for us to know in detail what would happen in each month. What we are told are the results of each phase, but not what processes, what works would result in that. For example, we know that on July 30th the NFT music marketplace and NFT music coinage site would be launched, but it is not said who would need to do what in order for this to be achieved. It would be important to detail the work of the professionals involved here. Most likely, developers and designers would be building the platform. How would your work routines be? The same can be said for the other deliveries. From the end of July to the end of September, the date of the next delivery, we have 2 months, but it is not said what would happen here. How the professionals involved in the project would be taking care of themselves so that continuity could be given. That said, the script, in my view, could be reworked, so that the information was conveyed in a more complete and detailed way. The budget part is also inadequate, the total amount requested is quite high (about 200 thousand dollars), and it is divided in a very basic way. We know which parts would make up the whole, such as: Media player, Marketplace Backend, Team growth, etc. But each of them could be better explained. For example in team growth, how many new developers would be hired? What kind of employees would be added, from which areas of expertise? What is “AWS”? And what would elastic and blockfrost search be? These are particular concepts that should have been explained, so that all readers would have a better understanding of how that money would be spent. The marketing part is essential for the success of any project, in my view; this one being even more so, since we want to attract an audience that is not necessarily familiar with the cryptographic universe. Finally speaking of the team, this is the best part of the topic as we know a lot of information from almost everyone involved. Their names, roles on the project, an extensively detailed resume, etc. My only suggestion would be that they all had the same level of detail, because some have a well-explained curriculum and others (like Nhan Nguyen) attach little information about themselves. That said, I think the topic is average, especially the script part needed to be better deepened.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of the proposal is, unfortunately, low. In the part of delivering partials, we have the same schedule that is attached in the script. Again, it is possible to monitor whether the results that were expected for a certain time were being achieved (for example, it is possible to check whether the music player would be launched on July 30th; but apart from deliveries, we have no way of auditing the development process itself. For this to be possible, it would be necessary that a better detailed roadmap had been attached, where we would know exactly what would happen, when and how. the work of everyone on the team: both developers, designers, advertisers, in short, as each professional progressed in their work in a certain time interval (for example, in 1 month). and not just the latter. Success is defined very briefly as “the launch of our Music NFT Marketplace: SoundRig.io.” But one would have to understand We saw two things: how this release affected the music industry, from artists to users; and also what were the impacts of all this for Cardano. Had the objectives of the challenge been achieved? Did the number of NFTs minted on the Cardano blockchain actually increase considerably from this project? Did artists realize the advantages of releasing music on web3 instead of web2? Has the number of active community members grown after the platform was launched? More Ada would be in circulation (it's unclear whether sales would actually be made on Ada). In other words, a broader and more in-depth study should be established, with quantitative and qualitative perspectives on the consequences of the project. With that, I think that auditability is quite inadequate and needs to be reformulated, both in terms of monitoring progress and final results; being that for progress we need to understand more about the work routine of the professionals involved, and in the final results it is necessary to understand in more detail what this project would generate for our blockchain and if what is being sought in the challenge would in fact be achieved. How can we ensure that the challenge KPIs (“Increasing the number of dapps and products available for the community to use that help to enrich the ecosystem with new use cases + Increase the number of integrations that bring existing solutions together for a more seamless and connected experience between different products + Increased quality of existing products & integrations through suggested improvements that are supported by customer feedback or increased usage by the community”) will be achieved?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal fits the challenge and can have a significant impact considering the sizeable potential customer base of music streaming platforms. However, some prominent players are already in the market (like Spotify). They have a plan to enter the market starting by enabling record labels from South Africa and local musicians from Nigeria to sign up for their platform. 

The creation of this marketplace meets the needs of the challenge criteria, but I'm not convinced about the information stated in the proposal: "Potentially offering paid promotional services (ex: Boosted artist will appear higher up in the category list or search result queue)
." This is, in my opinion, not a good feature on a decentralized application. The previous statement can also deter upcoming small musicians from signing up for the platform because they will be at a disadvantage. 

The proposal lacks technical details on how the user experience would work. There is also a lack of information on how the service will provide a better experience for the artist. For example, in the proposal, you could list the advantages of the proposed marketplace against other existing rivals in the marketspace (for example, Spotify).
f6_assessments.q1:
In the project team, I see professionals with good qualifications, and the information in the proposal is sufficient. What I miss in the group is someone who has a long (+15 years) career in the music industry to help guide the project. 

The deadline of July 30 2022, for the music NFT minting site is over-ambitious if you consider the Governance phase is likely not done yet. 

The budget is minimalistic, and in the proposal is stated they would come back later to secure extra funds. In this regard, I'm missing a financial roadmap to independent operations. I'm also missing who will work on the different tasks on the project. 

There are other blockchain music marketplaces that they will need to compete with, but I can not find any features why this project will stand out among the competitors. Therefore, I would advise including arguments explaining the advantages against other music marketplaces.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal will be measured with three goals in mind. There are no smaller deadlines or a breakdown of sub-deadlines. I would advise adding goals like the number of sales, artists on the platform, number of users etc. to name a few KPIs. The goals are also not well described. 

In the proposal, there is also no commitment written to report the progress publicly. Instead, you could use Github or the website to write reports on the progress every so often. Such reports would be an excellent way for the community to audit the progress.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea of ​​the project is generally in line with the criteria given by the "Dapps, Products & Integrations" challenge. This idea we may have come across somewhere, but it has certain values. The idea is basically to build a music platform in conjunction with NFT. The platform will allow musicians to mint their audio files on the Cardano blockchain into an NFT. These NFTs cannot be modified or tampered with, so they serve as a certificate of the musician's intellectual property rights. And musicians can sell them to fans. Having such a music platform combined with NFT is extremely necessary because for a long time intellectual property rights in real life have been a thorny issue for creators in certifying the ownership of music.  Therefore, this platform is absolutely essential in the blockchain space. This can attract more musicians to participate as well as increase the number of daily active users on the Cardano blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1:
The roadmap to implement this music platform associated with NFT is extremely detailed and clear. The proposal team provided us with information about the tasks that need to be done, the order in which the work will be done. However, I am a bit curious as to what time in the roadmap will we reach the audience of musicians as well as the plan to introduce the platform to the community?
Regarding the budget breakdown: I expect the proposal team can further explain to me and the community why we spend up to 300 hours on the backend marketplace work making them $50,000? And besides, what does marketing work include that costs $22,000? I think these are the key points to see if we've really covered the costs.
Experience of each team member: in this respect, I consider the proposed group to have enough experience and expertise to implement this musical foundational idea.
f6_assessments.q2:
I think the auditability of the project is only at a relatively safe level. The details of each group member have not been publicly disclosed yet. We do not have any links to individual information pages. It's not enough, in my opinion, to measure project progress by hitting launch dates. Because when the product is launched, but whether it has attracted users or not, is it popular for each audience, and if there are no customers, the project will not be considered a success. I would suggest adding details to measure success such as:
+ reach 10,000 users after 3 months of launch (for example)
+ has a close cooperation relationship with more than 50 musicians inside and outside the region
+ the number of downloads on the platform is 10,000 times.

f6_assessments.q0:
-	Awesome proposal submission the arts and entertainment space focussing on music and challenging business models in the music industry as we know them
-	This proposal brings together Digital Rights Management, Gamification, Incentivization, Ecommerce, ticketing, and social networking features all in one platform aiming to decentralize and disrupt the music industy by bringing labels, fans artists, event venues together 
-	In doing so, it challenges the Cardano Ecosystem to provide tools needed for such innovations to materialize and also positions Cardano to compete with some recent products like Audius (https://audius.co/)  & the UtopiaMusic ecosystem (https://utopiamusic.com/) and even develop cross chain compatible audio/video/media player
-	The team is qualified, diverse and experienced. The big challenge is more about implementing features, scaling up rapidly as a marketplace. This can benefit from Cardano’s roadmap for scaling up from the Basho era features (https://roadmap.cardano.org/en/basho/)
f6_assessments.q1:
-	The cost breakdown appears to be adequate and brings together competencies much needed at this stage ( technical , infrastructure, blockfrost, legal, customer experience design, project management and some marketing )
-	The longer term, vision and mission have been clearly explained. The roadmap and immediate objectives for this proposal with respective timeframes could be clarified. The team is not starting from scratch the focus appears to be building a music NFT player and marketplace.
-	Some further details on the go to market strategy could help better understand if there may be some gaps in this respect, i.e marketing and communications campaign and gearing up with an operations team, business developers & partnership managers  to develop the partnerships needed. 
-	Setting up a business model canvas to explore an operating business model could highlight some other gaps or hypotheses that the team is making ( https://www.strategyzer.com/canvas/business-model-canvas) 
In order to accelerate time to value, the team could consider looking at some of the references below: 
Some developments in the Ethereum space with regards to royalty standards : 
-	https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2981 - standard for royalties in Ethereum
-	https://cips.cardano.org/cips/cip27/#simplesummary standard for royalties in Cardano
-	https://www.openlaw.io/ - platform for legal smart contrats
Digital rights management : 
-	https://www.zdnet.com/finance/blockchain/new-platform-uses-nfts-as-a-gateway-for-digital-rights-management/ 
o	https://rair.tech/ - Blockchain based digital rights management platform
Cardano ecosystem integrations that may be of interest : 
-	Profila for CRM from Cardano ecosystem
-	https://www.clanity.com/#Platform  for social marketplace from Cardano ecosystem including business to business and business to customer features.
-	Integration with lending protocols to faciliate liquidity for those artists needing funding for creating content
o	https://www.meld.com/ from Cardano ecosystem
There are also some similar proposals in Fund9, so probably setting up a Cardano community focussing on the music industry, eg a Guild or even a consortium going forward could benefit everyone : 
-	Licensing Remixed Music On-Chain, https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/421968
-	Project Catalyst... for Musicians , https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/414440
-	DecentralizeMusic.com, https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/414289
-	FML : P2P sync licensing protocol , https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/418686
-	Cardano For Musicians , https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/419013
-	Perma-music rmNFT Marketplace, https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/415152
f6_assessments.q2:
-	The team is clear on customer acquisition and adoption being the key outcomes they are after through the launch of SoundRig.io. As there is a go to market phase, having some indicators for feedback collection eg : number of users using it, number of interviews, ( groups, individuals) , feature requests using a user-voice mechanism , could be useful to gauge how well the product is being received and the potential for growing it into a mature product.
-	As this is an arts & entertainment space with active players the product needs to be solid and stable in order to develop the acquisition level it clearly deserves. Poor user experience could probably adversely affect growth, so some caution may be needed there. The team is rather experienced, so I would assume this is taken care of.
-	Nonetheless, some operational KPIs may be handy as the user-base scales, eg, some performance related metrics like number of crashes of application, outages, support requests and resolution rates. This could inform the sizing of the operations team needed as the application scales, and  I sincerely hope it will

f6_assessments.q0:
The world music market is enormous and growing rapidly. Technology is developing increasingly, and blockchain is gradually being applied to reality, in which music is a large market share that many people are interested. So I think this proposal raises a significant and relatively large-scale problem.
This proposal meets the challenge of creating a soundrig.io application that will allow musicians to mint their audio files on the Cardano Blockchain with video and art. This project will attract more artists to join the application, attracting many new users. The team's idea was to develop a Music NFT Marketplace platform where musicians could create NFTs of music, play music using a String Media Player and share their musical NFTs with fans. Additionally, the process for musicians to monetize their work will be simplified with the sale of NFTs embedded with their music. In my opinion, the author can add some information such as how the process of casting the audio file is done and does it cost anything or is it completely free. So what will the NFT sale price be?
The team has identified several risks encountered when implementing the project and has detailed solutions to minimize these risks. In addition, I also have a few small ideas that I want to be answered by the team. It seems that NFT minting is quite simple on your application; anyone can experience and create NFT for themselves. This will have copyright and impersonation risks. Does your team have a solution to this problem? Does the team check the user and input audio data?
f6_assessments.q1:
This plan has been detailed and has a specific timeline and goals. The proposed budget represents 2.64% of the total Challenge budget. The amount has been divided into small portions. However, for the budget analysis to be more detailed, the author should explain and provide the basis of calculation for those expenditures. The more complex the budget, the more transparent and feasible the budget will be.
The information about the team members is quite complete by the author. They are all experienced and capable people, and information about their previous work is also verified thanks to the link provided by the author. In addition to this proposal, some group members have submitted many other proposals in Fund 9. They have had proposals funded from previous Funds. This is a plus point for the team because there are many ideas for Cardano. I found that they fit the goal of the proposal. However, the author should provide more work assignments for members to make it easier for readers to visualize and deliver more personal profile links for the community to verify their identities easily.
f6_assessments.q2: The author says that they will measure the project's progress by hitting the scheduled launch dates, and the success of this project is the launch of SoundRig.io. To be better, I think the author should come up with metrics like the number of users participating in the app, the number of NFTs generated, the number of NFTs sold, etc. So the team has to come up with a specific target number, and when that number is reached, the project is a success.

f6_assessments.q0:
"In my opinion, the problem stated here is quite aligned with the challenge. The solution that the team is suggesting is very well articulated. Thanks to a brief but clear introduction, we can see pretty much necessary details of the proposal such as its particular, scopes, targeted market, its impact, and benefit to Cardano and its users. 
The team’s intention is to bring a new platform for new music talents to put their work on the Cardano Blockchain. The process for musicians to monetize their work will be simplified with the sales of NFTs embedded with their music. Through that, they want to solve a part of the problem of a huge demand for an NFT Marketplace catering to music and audio while onboarding independent musicians from Web 2.0. This idea, for me, can really help enrich Cardano's ecosystem since it’s going to bring a new platform for new music talents, attracts new artists to Cardano, and also aim to bring Cardano to its new markets, especially in Africa and Asia. Moreover, it’ll connect experience between two existed products/platforms (CNFT Audio & Listening Room Collective. For those reasons, I strongly believe that this proposal completely aligns with the challenge. In terms of the risks, the team has pointed out 4 problems that they might face during the process and I agree with them on those 4 problems. I can see that the team also has clear ideas of how to solve those potential problems and that certainly makes this proposal a lot more reliable.
"
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility, the team has provided a roadmap with some milestones of the project, however, I would want to see a clearer timeline with more details of the work that needs to be done to reach those milestones and their time budget for that. It’ll be helpful for the community to follow up with the project and also the team can use it to keep track of their progress. A long-term plan should be worked on as well since we want to see more of the potential of the project and the commitment of the team to this plan. The budget breakdown is fair, and it follows closely with their milestone and it’s a good thing the team has done here. Hence, if the team can provide a more detailed timeline, it will be easier to give the requested fund a fairer justification. And last but not least, thank your team for a very thorough brief introduction of your team with each member’s skills, background, and past works. And it has shown that the team has enough human power to make this project work. I’m also well impressed with the ambassadors' networks the team has built.
f6_assessments.q2: When it comes to auditability, unfortunately, the team has not really given any reasonable key metrics and KPIs to audit the plan. With a roadmap that has a lot of milestones, I think the team should build a key metrics system for each milestone, especially for this kind of project, those key metrics such as the traffic, the number of users, the number of new artists on board, the number of work uploaded, the sale of NFTs and so on are very important because they define the success of the project. The short-term plan is to launch the marketplace, but we need a long-term vision of how the marketplace will benefit Cardano and its users as the main scope of this challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: While the main purpose of the proposal is clear, which is to develop an online music store that will allow musicians to play and NFT-mint their audio products, the proponent has yet to clarify the impact what is this project will bring for Cardano and does it align with the Challenge's key metric that further drives the adoption of the Cardano blockchain. Currently, there are many ideas about building a music exchange platform between artists and fans, minting NFTs from music products, So what is the biggest competitive advantage of this project that can attract the user base and artists who choose to use the proponent's platform. Although the proponent has addressed this issue and offered brand awareness solutions to find customers, the proponent has yet to make an effort to demonstrate the optimal features and utility of the platform. What makes their platform different is to be able to increase brand awareness with other platforms. The description of the platform is still very general, I can't understand how it works, how the NFT minting will happen (NFT minting fee, NFT pricing standard, is there any regulation on how many NFTs can be generated on the same audio file, what is the transaction method if the client wants to buy the NFT, etc.). The biggest risk related to art platforms and NFT minting in popular is related to copyright, there will be cases where people mint NFT from audio files that are not owned by their copyright, so where this risk reduction measure has not yet been considered and mentioned by the proponent.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan doesn't go into detail, we can only know the exact platform release date, other than that there are no time estimates for the rest of the work mentioned, and the proponent also has no plans for a Demo release or review or modification based on user feedback. If the plan lacks milestones, it will be difficult for the community to track the progress of the project. The plus point here is that the budget is described quite fully, we can know the resources needed to develop this project, and the author also tries to calculate the working remuneration of the members based on their total hours worked, If possible, I encourage the author to update the number of members for each position. The team that develops and supports the work of this project consists of a large number of members with specialized knowledge and background in music and information technology. The authenticity of the member information they provide can be easily checked through the attached links. However, there is some members' working experience that is not really necessary to list here such as Air Traffic Controller, as they don't seem to be very relevant to the field of the proposal. In general, the project's personnel is enough for us to trust their ability to operate this project well.
f6_assessments.q2: The project's success is described by the proponent as more akin to the target work they will achieve than a KPI that the community can measure success. Project success should be specific metrics that are estimated after completion of the main product at timelines like 3-6 months, 1 year, etc. For this project the basic metrics to measure could be the number of artists and users involved in the platform, the number of NFTs minted, the revenue achieved, etc. The author has not yet provided the community with different methods/tools to track project progress, some suggestions for proponents about possible measurement tools are publications on social platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Telegram, etc), blog posts, periodic community reports, etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea do have an impact for the ecosystem, and could adopt more users to use blockchain tech in the future, especially Cardano. Many independent talented musicians would love an alternative platform that could benefit them in terms of value and getting rewarded/paid fully to the artists. Blockchain enables this. I believe as the rate of growth of Web3, current music platforms would decline substantially and the younger generations will be wanting their digital rights through blockchain technology. NFTs are a good way to create deep value for consumers and it has proven to do and I feel that Cardano needs a music marketplace. This will expand the ecosystem further. 

Based on the proposed solution to address the Challenge, I feel like that the proposer could further explain more on the how(s) to onboard the current independent musicians on Cardano as well as other countries. Like, SoundRig will reward the first 100 artists that subscribe and distribute their music on the marketplace.

For the main risks that could prevent from delivering, I would suggest that (Risk 1: not getting funding for necessary Devs) you could point out what are the necessary Devs needed. From the websites (such as Daband.io/Soundrig.io), much work needed to be done towards its branding and user experience. We need to always compare with other successful music platforms' (Spotify/Apple Music/Waves) functionality and accessibility for user experience for mass adoption. For (Risk 2: Difficulty growing customer base), as stated above, the proposer could onboard musicians from Web2 by rewarding them with ADA tokens, for example. Overall, there are well detailed points on the risks and solutions that needed to be addressed.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team have provided a roadmap but it can be further broken down. For example, Music NFT Marketplace - work with designers and developers for the marketplace architecture, discuss on its main features that could make the marketplace stand out, its unique selling point, and how to improve user experience (e.g we will have 4 weeks to carefully plan the structure and core of the marketplace). I believe that users would want to know more about the features/accessibility/functionality of the marketplace. For example, SoundRig will have a feature that users could create an album as an NFT. Or SoundRig provides a a security where users' music have their copyrights and will ban if there is a copy of sound signatures. Despite onboarding users into the marketplace, the team need to measure the traffic of users, hours spent on its dApps, and to expand it to a mobile dApp to reach more normies. These are my take for its roadmap, and plan.

Given the relevant experience of the team members with such great background, this proposal can be implemented successfully. But more detailed/careful planning must be met. Based on the budget breakdown, the team can further breakdown what are the key points needed for each of the budget costs. Such as, media player. What are the challenges needed, developers assigned, features implemented on this. From this, we can then also provide the details such as fees on the marketplace, how does the team gain revenue. A simple explanation would suffice and could better let the reader understand the mission and vision of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is quite sufficient to  audit the progress but as stated, the roadmap and plan can be further detailed to let the voters know more of its milestones, and how it can gather feedback from users through its process of executing the project. From it roadmap, the release date of its minting site is scheduled on the 30th of july. What worries me that this would not have breathing-space for a more detailed planning of its project. Further down the line, I would suggest that actively gathering feedback on the platform via Twitter/Discord/Telegram can make much impact to succesfully move towards what the Cardano users want, and eventually what the masses want. Also, I would like to add key metrics that can be measured while progressing. These are, the number of artists using the platform, the number of music NFTs sold, the number of following on Twitter/Discord (for marketing purposes) and etc.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is suitable for challenge setting. There are many NFT marketplaces for artwork, paintings, photos that have achieved great success and show us the effective application of blockchain to transparency in the market. For music is also possible, the problem of music copyright is quite serious for music creators, and this does not have a clear solution on web2 platforms. Allowing musicians to mint their audio files on the Cardano Blockchain solves this problem and I think it's a potential project to invest in.
The project poses a lot of risks but in return offers reasonable solutions. Regarding the risk of not being funded and the budget is limited, in addition to launching the main sale to get a small amount of funds, I suggest you to issue a token, which will help to expand the budget with small amounts of funds. invest. If the project can thrive in the future, the project's tokens will likely become the main source of funding for the project's development.
f6_assessments.q1: The project's roadmap is not really complete when I don't see the amount of work that the team undertakes, the issues of building the foundation, building the market will be taken by anyone, who will participate in the implementation. I think you should clarify this as this is a fairly large project, the assignment should be detailed. Thank you for providing very detailed information of project members and related experiences, and I find that the team is very experienced in relation to the development of this project, the number of members is also appropriate with such a big project, this will reduce the work pressure on the members. I have no opinion on the budget part, because I think the expenses are reasonable, the only part I find incomplete is the roadmap of the proposal, which requires reforming this part.
f6_assessments.q2: The entire audit part of the project is explained rather superficially. In my opinion, reaching launch date milestones is incomplete when measuring project progress, project success should be measured by number of NFTs of music created, number of users and musicians, number of creators music joining the platform, number of music NFT transactions,... The success of your project is unsatisfactory, you should add the goals in progress in more detail, this will help the community have a more solid view of the transparency of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is clearly stated and matches the challenge. There currently isn´t a NFT Marketplace for music but there is definatly demand which is seen on other blockchains where musicians made and sold music and incomerights as NFTs. 
The proposal wants to create the demanded marketplace. An NFT marketplace for music with a Cross chain media player. 
In conclusion the proposal creates an new marketplace for Cardano with a new usability which can bring new users. Therefore it clearly matches the challenge strongly.
f6_assessments.q1:
Most of the team have linked relevant links. Overall they have much experience and seem capable to implement the proposal. In addition they have linked their sides. The sides look competently made.
The budget is clearly describes the allocation of money to different tasks. Overall it seems fair but for one exception. 50.000 $ are allocated for the market backend. They need 300 hours. Overall it is an hourly salary of 166.67$. Please clarify this. The rational on the high salary is unclear. 
The timeplan is a good overview. They have shown when they want to release the different parts of the application. You could have went more into the detail and shown the process of the development. This would have made the process more transparent for the reader.
Overall on tiny thing in the budget is unclear and the timeplan lacks a little in detail therefore I remove one star.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are no KPIs or metrics provided. Please create some metrics to measure success like number of users, number of transactions….
The timeplan clearly shows when they want to release their parts of the application. This can be observed form the outside. 
The success goal isn´t clearly described except for “launch of the marketplace”. You could have made it more clear and given some things that you want to achieve for example the impact on the musicians, fill the demand and make concurrence to the current music market. 
Overall I don’t think that this proposal is easy to audit because the infos aren´t provided. Therefor I give 2 stars

f6_assessments.q0:
"The music business is enormous and prosperous. Many artists today use electronic and social media channels to distribute their works. The main issue, though, is that artists could need to provide the platform's owner a considerable amount of money. I do agree with the idea of SoungRig that develop the platform so that musicians may keep the majority of their sales thanks to the blockchain technology. 
SoungRig may pique the attention of artists thus increase the utility and adoption of Cardano by inviting current independent musicians. From this viewpoint, the Cardano ecosystem may be enriched by new users, and the solution proposed here is aligned with the challenge.
The proposers should have explained more clearly and in-detail about how this platform works (maybe some more technical points). The proposers have listed out and addressed quite well the risks. I would like to add some more risks and challenges. Firstly, what are the main differences between this project and other blockchain-based music platform? Secondly, NFTs have bad reputation regarded to copyright or stealing arts from others, how do the proposers deal with this risk?"
f6_assessments.q1:
"The proposers provided the roadmap about the release date of the platform e.g., marketplace, or media player. However, to clarify the proposal, the proposers should break down these milestones into several smaller tasks, and give them the deadlines. For example, for the “Music NFT Marketplace”, it may consist of conceptualization, designing the marketplace, etc. 
A budget cost was also provided. To make the plan more understandable, I believe they should provide the detail financial calculations. For example, whye does do the “Elastic Search” cost $1200, the “Marketing” section cost $22,000? Mover, the proposers should allocate the funding to each task process. If the proposal becomes clearer, it will be easy for readers to evaluate the feasibility of this project.
Regarding to the human resources, the core team has strong backgrounds in terms of blockchain and NFTs, and has been working with music and Cardano-related projects – which is the essential experience when working in this field. This will increase the feasibility of the project."
f6_assessments.q2: In my opinion, the proposers should specify the exact KPIs/metrics used to quantify success and the numbers they want to accomplish, not just by reaching the milestones. To increase the auditability bt the community, some metrics are recommended to be used such as the number of artists and listeners in the platforms, the number of songs/albums released, the number of NFTs created and sold, etc. The proposers should provide some more information e.g., reports to the community (e.g., weekly, monthly reports, etc.) for easier auditing.

f6_assessments.q0:
As a music lover, I have great expectations for the proposal related to music, but in general, the proposer's presentation and explanation is still not mature, and there is still a lot of confusion. The goal of this proposal is to assist artists in using NFT music and sharing it with their fans more widely via Cardano Blockchain with video and art. Furthermore, it generates revenue for musicians by allowing them to monetize their work through the sale of NFTs embedded in their music. However, I have yet to see instructions on how musicians will sell their products, or how fans will be able to listen to the music of their idols. Users and investors will struggle to imagine how the product will work in the absence of specific instructions. In addition, the author's solutions are not really in line with The Challenge's Key Metrics. The phrase "increase the utility and adoption of Cardano" is mentioned, but this is insufficient to meet The Challenge's requirements.
The only part of this section that the author does well is the methods for dealing with future problems. It is clear that the proposer anticipates the challenges and offers solutions, which I believe is very appropriate. I especially agree on how to solve the problem of attracting users from other blockchains. The author has decided to attend other blockchain conventions as well as take advantage of strategic partnerships with Cardano and other blockchain projects. It not only ensures a certain number of participants, but it also increases brand awareness. A fairly comprehensive solution to this pressing issue.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has done an excellent job of recruiting elite employees with extensive industry experience. As can be seen, the list of people involved in the proposal is quite long, and the majority of them are completely appropriate for the proposal's purpose. Furthermore, I appreciate the proposer's decision to recruit more credible ambassadors. This not only ensures the proposal's popularity or reputation, but also the quality of the proposal's product. Furthermore, the budget is completely transparent and clear. Amounts will be charged by the hour rather than days or weeks as in other proposals, but for $2,200 for marketing, the author must indicate how the proposal will proceed. The proposer must be clear about whether the proposal will be promoted in the press or on social media. The roadmap for the proposal also is still a bit hazy and unclear. For example, the Music NFT Minting Site was released on July 30, 2022, but the author has not described what it includes. This will make it difficult for investors to understand the purpose and function of each component.
f6_assessments.q2: Like the above, in the development of the proposal, the author just repeats everything that is written in the plan. Overall it has the necessary information that is the timeline for completing each task, and I appreciate this part because there are not many proposals that pay attention to timelines. However, in terms of the success of the proposal, just the launch of the Music NFT Marketplace: SoundRig.io is not enough. Here, the author needs to clarify more clearly the achievements that the proposal will aim for, such as the number of fans accessing the site to listen to music, the number of musicians who will use the product, or most importantly, what specific benefits will it bring to the Cardano ecosystem?

solution: We will be developing a one-stop shop Music NFT Marketplace where musicians can mint a music NFTs, play their music with our Cross-Chain Media Player, and share their Music NFTs with their fans.
experience:
Tobias Steffen & Sunny Basra were the Integration Partner and Client Relations Managers for (NFT-MAKER).
Quintin Bray-Stone is a founder of (DaBand.io)
Nhan Nguyen & Tuan Pham are Software Engineers for (https://www.uac.edu.au/) & (NFTjam)
